intro: Fimbriella praeclara, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, star-shaped thallus that is covered in fine, delicate structures called fissures. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as gemmae, are produced in clusters and aid in its vegetative propagation. The plant's unique morphology and ecological preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
